required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IM21 CAR-T Cells in the Treatment of Elderly Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of IM21 CAR-T Cells in the Treatment of Elderly Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Immunochina Medical Science & Technology Co., Ltd.

clinical_study.source: Beijing Immunochina Medical Science & Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single center study to assess the efficacy and safety of IM21 CAR-T cells in adult with R/R multiple myeloma in China.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, about 10 patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma aged ≥60 years were recruited for IM21 CAR-T cell single transfusion therapy. The safety and tolerability of the treatment were evaluated, and the curative effect was initially observed. The research plan includes five stages: screening stage, cell collection stage, chemotherapy pretreatment stage, infusion stage and follow-up stage.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events within 1 month after CAR-T cell infusion
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint wasIncidence of adverse events within 1 month after CAR-T cell infusion

arm_group.description: IM21 CAR-T cells administrated in a dosage to be selected by physician from a specific range.

intervention.description: IM21 CAR-T cells Drug: Fludarabine Two days before cell infusion, all patients will be treated with fludarabine for 3 days Drug: Cyclophosphamide Two days before cell infusion, all patients will be treated with Cyclophosphamide for 3 days Other Names: Fludarabine Cyclophosphamide
